summary: This is a Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9-10, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, staff assignments, and sensitive information including inmates on suicide watch and in a dry cell. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of prison conditions and administrative procedures at the MCC around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration there.

persons.name: Jones
persons.context: Inmate with registration #06178-104 whose treaty transfer was canceled due to mechanical problems and who was later transferred out.

persons.name: Garcia
persons.context: Inmate with registration #79043-054 placed on the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for a code violation (Code #111) and later placed in Administrative Detention for introduction of tobacco.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Monitoring
events.description: Routine prison operations at MCC New York including inmate counts, staff assignments, equipment checks, and monitoring of inmates on suicide watch and in a dry cell.

events.title: Inmate Admissions and Releases
events.description: Several inmates were admitted to and released from MCC New York, and one inmate (Jones) had a treaty transfer canceled due to mechanical problems.

events.title: Inmate Disciplinary Action
events.description: Inmate Garcia (#79043-054) was placed in Administrative Detention for introduction of tobacco.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a detailed operations log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9-10, 2019.
It notes multiple inmates on suicide watch with inmate companions and one inmate (Fernandez) placed in a dry cell.
The report indicates chronic staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments.
Key equipment, including the Control Center Fire Panel and the public address system, was inoperative, affecting safety and operational procedures.
The log meticulously tracks inmate movements, counts, and administrative actions, providing a record of standard prison operations.
